page.title: 18UPPER KILLAY VILLAGE
page.content: Upper Killay or Cila Uchaf,to give it its Welsh name, is a linear village on the fringe of Swansea and on the main route from that city to the Gower Peninsula.As in the case of Dunvant and Three Crosses,it grew in size as a result of mining and quarrying development in the last century.These industries have now ceased and apart from a creamery and small engineering company, the area is residential with four small farms. Most of the houses are privately owned but there is a small Council house estate.
